neutral.name: Neutral Space
neutral.desc: This space can be freely traversed and have no additional effects.

shop.name: Shop
shop.desc: A player who lands on this space receives a random item, if there is room in the player's inventory.

altar.name: Altar
altar.desc: A player on this space is allowed to make one wish. At the end of the turn, all players who made wishes have their wishes granted and then are returned to Start. Multiple players on this space do not engage in combat. Emits light level 5.

start.name: Start Square
start.desc: All new players start on this square. Players sharing this space do not fight, and any player on this space does not lose HP for any reason. A player who ends his turn on Start is cured of any status ailments.

gap.name: Empty Gap
gap.desc: These spaces are ordinarily impassible to players. If a player is forced onto a gap, they immediately return to Start and loses 5 HP. A player who is adjacent to a gap can choose to leap into the gap.

giver.name: Silver Giver
giver.desc: Anyone on this space at the end of the turn receives a Silver Coin.

black.name: Darkness
black.desc: A space shrouded in darkness; you can't tell what it is from this distance.

highway.name: Speed Highway
highway.visual: light blue space with dark blue 'interstate' sign
highway.desc: This space is always considered adjacent to its paired Speed Highway space. Players standing on one of the two may expend one movement point to move to the other.

grass.name: Grass
grass.desc: This space behaves like a neutral space but cannot become tainted. At the end of the turn, if this tile has fewer than two grass tiles adjacent or diagonally-adjacent to it, it becomes a dirt tile. If this tile has more than three grass tiles adjacent or diagonally-adjacent to it, it becomes a Tree Space.

dirt.name: Dirt
dirt.desc: This space behaves like a neutral space. At the end of the turn, if a dirt tile is surrounded (adjacent or diagonally) by either 2 or 3 grass tiles, it becomes a grass tile. Alternatively, if a dirt tile is adjacent or diagonally-adjacent to a water tile, the dirt becomes a grass tile.

tree.name: Tree Space
tree.visual: teal space with green tree clipart
tree.desc: Light passing through this space is diminished by one. Moving onto this space costs two movement points. Tree Spaces cannot be tainted, and they cure the tainted status on adjacent and diagonally-adjacent spaces. At the end of the turn, if this tile has one or fewer grass tiles adjacent to it, it becomes a grass tile.

water.name: Water Space
water.desc: A player who moves onto this space must stop here.

tneutral.name: Tainted Neutral Space
tneutral.visual: empty gray space with tainted border
tneutral.desc: This space requires 2 movement points to move onto. This space is Tainted.

yeolde.name: Ye Olde Shoppe
yeolde.desc: A player who is on this space can exchange any coins for random items. The following currency types are not accepted: ruthenium, rhodium, palladium, osmium, iridium, platinum, and gold. A player does not have to stop on this space to exchange.

fire.name: Fire Space
fire.visual: greenish space with Fire on it
fire.desc: Anyone who passes this space takes damage equal to their ATK power. Emits light level 2.

item.name: Item
item.desc: Icon used to represent items on the map.

goldcoin.name: Gold Coin
goldcoin.desc: Can be picked up by a player. Always protected from wishes. Emits light level 1.

silvercoin.name: Silver Coin
silvercoin.desc: Can be picked up by a player. These are like gold coins, but are not protected by the game's rules and have no intrinsic value. Emits light level 1.

war.name: War
war.desc: Moves randomly each turn, attacking any player or other token who ends up on the same space. Permanently gains 1 ATK whenever he successfully kills anyone. If he dies, War respawns on a random space the following turn, with his ATK reset to 1.

famine.name: Famine
famine.desc: Moves randomly each turn. If he ends up on the same space as another player, Famine rots one food- or drink- themed item in that player's inventory at random.

pestilence.name: Pestilence
pestilence.desc: Moves randomly each turn. At the end of the turn, whatever space Pestilence lands on becomes tainted.

death.name: Death
death.desc: Moves randomly each turn. If he lands on the same space as a player, that player may challenge Death to a deadly game of dice. If the player wins the game of chance, he gets a random useful item. If the player loses, he dies.

fireproof.name: Fireproof
fireproof.desc: This space can never be converted into a Fire Space.

rulings.desc: Any Altar wishes occur at the end of the turn, after all player movement is completed.
Effects which target a stat that a token lacks have no effect on the token. For example, a space that deals damage will not affect a token who has no concept of HP.

The specific nature of combat in the case of tokens which are deficient in some stats is this. All involved players or tokens who have an ATK stat will attack all involved players or tokens who have an HP stat. All such attacks happen simultaneously, and in general a token will never attack itself unless otherwise stated.

In general, an action which attempts to move into a gap is considered to be a mistake or a typo, and the player will not be allowed to move into the gap. If the movement into the gap was intentional, this should be specified in the post. This ruling does not apply if the player in question has any equipment that would enable him or her to pass the gaps without the normal penalty.

The larger the magnitude of a wish, the less likely it is to end up in the wisher's favor. That is, a simple wish is likely to go exactly as intended. A large and complicated wish may be interpreted extremely literally and the results may not be what was desired.
